poem:
A Barrier of Words

In Belfast,
PSNI Land Rovers line up like tin soldiers,
riot helmets nodding heavy heads
beneath a pale sky.

Fireworks fizzle—a short-lived rebellion,
voices clash with car alarms,
echoes of a disquieted dawn.

Two sides, one road,
divided by metal and uniformed resolve,
a temporary, fragile peace,
reflecting the width of our silences.
